author: Bald Condensed

comments.content: Congrats, Kris! Very nice article; refreshingly free of bemusement.
I agree; I thought it was fantastic. It’s great to see an article that goes beyond “Obama uses Gotham” to really delve into type design.
One of the best articles on type design I’ve read. And Kris – what a great rock pose! :-)
Nah, that’s his “extra from The Sopranos” pose. ;^) :^P

That is without doubt the best photo of a type designer I’ve ever seen. He looks downright hot.

Money quote:  
_‘I’m interested in designing typefaces. Do you have any advice for me?’ and he said, ‘Don’t bother. There’s no money in it.’_

Does that mean that there’s actually money to be had in graphic design?

And if anyone’s at all interested, you can view a tiny thumbnail of the spread (looks like they tried some interesting type arrangements, but it’s hard to tell) if you go to [http://fairfaxmedia.newspaperdirect.com/epaper/viewer.aspx](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122015204/http:/fairfaxmedia.newspaperdirect.com/epaper/viewer.aspx "http://fairfaxmedia.newspaperdirect.com/epaper/viewer.aspx") and under select title, choose Sunday Papers \> Sunday Magazine, and then browse through the thumbnails. Unfortunately, a bigger view requires paid subscription.

Congrats, Kris, and very nice article.  
I realized now that “Klim” reads “milk” backwards, I like this sort os ideas, made me think of Trugoy of De La Soul.
